source_sentence: 佛說婆羅門子命終愛念不離經
translation: Foshuo prātimokṣasūtra

source_sentence: 後漢安息沙門安世高譯
translation: Translated by An Shigao, the Latter Han monk Anshi

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在舍衛城祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 彼時有異婆羅門，有一子命終愛念不離。
translation: At the time, there was a different Brāhmaṇa who had a son whose craving didn't part with him when he died.

source_sentence: 彼命終亦不能食，亦不能飲，亦不著衣亦不塗香，但至塚間而啼泣，彼啼泣憶念在抱上。
translation: At the end of his life, he can't eat or drink, doesn't put on his robes or rub it with fragrance, but goes to a cemetery and cries out, and he weeps and remembers it in his arms.

source_sentence: 於是彼婆羅門彷徉而行至世尊所，到已共世尊面相慰勞。
translation: That Brāhmaṇa then wandered and went to the Bhagavān, and when he arrived, he comforted himself with the Bhagavān's face.

source_sentence: 面相慰勞已，彼婆羅門却坐一面已。
translation: After they had comforted each other, the Brāhmaṇa withdrew and sat to one side.
The Bhagavān told him, Why is that?
Are your Brāhmaṇas' faculties impermanent and determined?
“O Gautama!
What's the mind faculty of self and what's the mind faculty that should be concentrated?

source_sentence: 我有一子而命終，愛念不離。
translation: I had a son who died, and his cravings were not separated.

source_sentence: 彼命終，我不能食、不能飲、不著衣、不塗香，我但在家啼泣，啼泣時憶念在抱上。」
translation: When their life ends, I can't eat, drink, don't put on my robe or ointment with incense, and when I'm at home weeping and wailing, I remember it in my embrace.
“So it is, so it is.
O brāhmaṇa!
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 愛生已則有憂慼苦不樂。」
translation: After craving arises, then there's grief, anguish, pain, and unpleasantness.
“What do you think, Gotama?
Shouldn't it be so?

source_sentence: 愛生已，當有憂慼苦不樂耶？
translation: After craving arises, will there be grief, sorrow, pain, and displeasure?
This is Gautama!
After craving arises, there will be joy and affection.

source_sentence: 再三，世尊告彼婆羅門曰：「如是如是。
translation: Again and again, the Bhagavān addressed that Brāhmaṇa, So it is, so it is.
O brāhmaṇa!
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 愛生已，則有憂慼啼泣不樂。」
translation: After craving arises, then there's grief, lamentation, weeping, and unhappyness.

source_sentence: 再三，彼婆羅門白世尊曰：「云何，瞿曇！
translation: Again and again, that Brāhmaṇa said to the Bhagavān, What do you think, Gautama?
Shouldn't it be so?
After craving arises, is there grief and displeasure?
This is Gautama!
After craving arises, there's only joy and affection.

source_sentence: 於是彼婆羅門聞世尊所說，亦不樂、不說非。
translation: When that Brāhmaṇa heard what the Bhagavān taught, he didn't delight in it and didn't say anything wrong.

source_sentence: 不樂、不然可已，從坐起便還。
translation: He didn't delight in or disagree with it, but got up from his seat and returned.

source_sentence: 彼時祇桓門外有諸戲人共戲，彼婆羅門遙見祇桓門外有諸戲人共戲，見已作是念：「世間聰明者此是最勝，
translation: At the time, there were playful people outside the gate of Jeta’s city. Seeing from a distance that there were playful people outside the gate of Jeta’s city, the brahman thought:

source_sentence: 我寧可所可共沙門瞿曇論者，盡當向彼戲人說之。」
translation: Whatever I can discuss with the ascetic Gautama, I'll explain it to that playful person.

source_sentence: 於是彼婆羅門便至彼諸戲人所，到已所可共世尊論者，盡向彼戲人說之。
translation: That Brāhmaṇa then went to those playful people and told them everything he could discuss with the Bhagavān when he arrived.

source_sentence: 如是說已，彼諸戲人報彼婆羅門曰：「此婆羅門！
translation: After he said this, the gathered people reported to the Brāhmaṇa, saying, This is a Brāhmaṇa!
Shouldn't it be so?

source_sentence: 愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂耶？
translation: After craving arises, then there's grief, sorrow, pain, and unpleasantness?
This is a Brāhmaṇa!
After craving arises, there will be joy and affection.

source_sentence: 於是彼婆羅門作是念：「此諸戲人語與我等。」
translation: That Brāhmaṇa then had this thought, 'These playful people speak to us.'
After turning his head around, he departed.

source_sentence: 彼所論則廣聞，次第徹王宮。
translation: The treatise he discussed was widely heard, and it penetrated the king's palace in order.

source_sentence: 王波斯匿聞之，沙門瞿曇作是言：「愛生已則有憂慼苦不樂。」
translation: When King Prasenajit heard this, the ascetic Gautama said, After craving arises, there's grief, anguish, pain, and unpleasantness.

source_sentence: 王波斯匿聞已，告末利夫人曰：「此末利！
translation: After hearing this, King Prasenajit told Lady Māra, This is Māra!

source_sentence: 我聞沙門瞿曇作是言：『愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂。』」
translation: I've heard the ascetic Gautama say, 'After craving arises, there's grief, anguish, pain, and displeasure.'
“So it is, so it is.
Great king!

source_sentence: 愛生已，則有苦憂慼不樂。」
translation: After craving arises, then there's suffering, grief, anguish, and unpleasantness.
This is Māra!
I hear what your teacher says, and so do my disciples.
You, Māra!

source_sentence: 彼沙門瞿曇是汝師，而今汝作是言：『愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂。』」
translation: That ascetic Gautama is your teacher, but now you say, 'After craving arises, there's sorrow, pain, and neither pleasure.'
“O great king!

source_sentence: 聞我所說不信者，便可自往、若遣使。」
translation: If someone hears what I teach and doesn't believe it, they can go there themselves or send an envoy.

source_sentence: 於是王波斯匿告那梨鴦伽婆羅門曰：「汝那梨鴦伽！
translation: King Prasenajit then addressed the Brāhmaṇa Nārāyaṅga, saying, You, Nārāyaṅga!
He went to that ascetic Gautama.

source_sentence: 到已以我言問訊沙門瞿曇，無量問訊，安隱輕舉有力不？
translation: On arriving, he greets the renunciant Gotama with my words and inquires about his immeasurable greetings. Is your well-being light and strong?
He said, 'This is Gautama!

source_sentence: 王波斯匿無量問訊，安隱輕舉有力不？
translation: Does King Prasenajit have the strength to calmly and quietly lift it?
Indeed, ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 作是言：「愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂耶？」』
translation: He said, After craving arises, will there be grief, pain, and unpleasantness?
This is Narī Aṅga!

source_sentence: 若彼沙門瞿曇作是說，汝當善受持誦習之。
translation: If that ascetic Gautama says this, you should well accept it, recite it, and practice it.
Why is it so?
They don't speak falsely.

source_sentence: 彼那梨鴦伽婆羅門速受王波斯匿教已，至世尊所，到已共世尊面相慰勞，
translation: The brāhmaṇa Nāri Aṅga, having quickly received the instruction of King Prasenajit, came to the place where the World-honored One was. Having arrived there, he joined the World-honored One in greeting [the Buddha
They greeted each other and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 彼那梨鴦伽婆羅門却坐一面已，白世尊曰：「此瞿曇！
translation: After he sat to one side, the Nāri aṅga Brahman said to the Bhagavān, This is Gautama!

source_sentence: 波斯匿王無量問訊，安隱輕舉有力不？
translation: King Prasenajit has an immeasurable number of questions and greetings, so is he at ease and strong?

source_sentence: 實沙門瞿曇作是言：『愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂耶？』」
translation: Really, the ascetic Gautama says, 'After craving arises, will there be grief, anguish, pain, and neither pleasure?'
This is Narī Aṅga!

source_sentence: 我還問汝，隨所有力當還報之。
translation: I'll ask you back, and you'll return it as quickly as you can.
What do you think of Narakaṅga?

source_sentence: 或有人母命終，彼母命終意狂亂，躶形不著衣隨彼遊行，作如是言：『我不見母、我不見母。』
translation: Perhaps someone's mother dies and their mind is crazy when she dies, and they walk with her crude form without wearing a robe and say, 'I don't see my mother; I don't see my mother.'

source_sentence: 此婆羅門當知之，愛生已則有憂慼苦不樂。
translation: You should know that after craving arises, this Brāhmaṇa has grief, anguish, pain, and unpleasantness.

source_sentence: 如是父兄姊妹若婦命終，彼婦命終已則意狂亂，躶形不著衣隨彼遊行，
translation: Thus, if a father, brother, sister, or someone else’s wife dies, and that woman’s life ends, their mind is in distress. They are coarse and don’t wear clothes, so they wander around like this.
He said, 'I don't see my father and wife.'
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 當知此愛生已則有憂慼苦不樂。
translation: You should know that once this desire arises, there’s grief, sorrow, pain, and unpleasantness.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 昔有一人婦還歸家，彼親屬欲奪與他人，彼婦人聞之，親屬欲持我與他人。
translation: In the past, there was a man whose wife returned home and his relatives wanted to steal it from her and give it to someone else.
After hearing this, the woman quickly ran back.

source_sentence: 還至己夫所，到已語彼夫曰：『君當知，我親屬欲持我與他人。
translation: When he returned to his husband, he said to him, 'You should know that my relatives want to take me and give it to others.
Whatever you should do, now you will do it.'

source_sentence: 於是彼人作極利刀，持彼婦人手還入屋中，作如是言：『當共同去，當共同去。』
translation: That person then made an extremely sharp sword, took the woman's hand, went back into the room, and said, 'We'll go together, we'll go together.'
He cut off the woman's life and also cut off his own life.
This is a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 當知此愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂。」
translation: You should know that once this craving arises, there's grief, pain, and unpleasantness.

source_sentence: 於是那梨鴦伽婆羅門聞世尊所說，善受持誦習已，從坐起，繞世尊已離世尊，
translation: Then the brāhmaṇa Nāri Aṅga, having heard what the World-honored One said, accepted, memorized, and remembered what he had been taught, rose from his seat, circumambulated the World-honored One, and departe
He returned to the king Prasenajit's place.

source_sentence: 到已白王波斯匿曰：「實爾，大王！
translation: When he arrived, he said to King Prasenajit, Yes, great king!

source_sentence: 彼沙門瞿曇作是說：『愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂。』」
translation: That ascetic Gautama says, 'After craving arises, there's grief, anger, pain, and unpleasantness.'

source_sentence: 於是王波斯匿告末利夫人曰：「實爾，末利！
translation: King Prasenajit then addressed Lady Māra, saying, Indeed, Māra!

source_sentence: 彼沙門瞿曇作是說：『愛生已，則有憂慼苦不樂。』」
translation: That ascetic Gautama says, 'After craving arises, there's grief, anger, pain, and unpleasantness.'
Therefore, great king!

source_sentence: 我還問王，隨所有力當報之。
translation: I'll return to the king and ask him, and he will be rewarded according to his powers.
What does the king think?
Do you love the general of Kālôdayin?
This is Māra!
I love that general of Kālôdayin.
“O great king!

source_sentence: 彼鞞留羅大將，是敗壞、是變異，生苦憂慼不樂不？」
translation: Is that general of Kālôdayin destroyed or changed, and does he give rise to suffering, grief, anguish, and neither pleasure?
This is Māra!

source_sentence: 鞞留羅大將，有敗壞變異，則有憂慼苦不樂。」
translation: When the general of Uruvilvā has defeat and change, there's grief, pain, and unpleasantness.
“O great king!

source_sentence: 當以此知之，愛生已則有憂慼苦不樂。
translation: You should know that after craving arises, there's grief, anger, pain, and unpleasantness.
What does the king think?

source_sentence: 愛賢首大將，愛一奔陀利大象，愛婆夷提女，愛婆沙剎諦隷(夫人)，
translation: They love the general Bhadravyūha, they love the great elephant Puṇḍarīka, they love the daughters of Upāsikā, and they love the goddess Vasiṣṭacāritra.
Do you love the people of Kāśi?
This is Māra!
They love the people of Kāśī Kośala.
“O great king!

source_sentence: 迦尸拘薩羅人民，亦是敗壞有變異，生苦憂慼不樂不？」
translation: Are the people of Kāśi Kośala also decaying and changing, producing pain, grief, anguish, and neither pleasure?
This is Māra!

source_sentence: 諸五婬欲自娛樂者，皆因迦尸拘薩羅人民。
translation: The five sexual desires for self-enjoyment are all caused by the people of Kāśi Kośala.
This is Māra!

source_sentence: 迦尸人民敗壞變異者，我命不全，況當不生苦憂慼不樂？」
translation: If the people of Kāśi were to decay and change, my life wouldn't be complete, so why wouldn't suffering, grief, anguish, and unpleasantness arise?
“O great king!

source_sentence: 當知此愛生已，則有苦憂慼不樂。
translation: You should know that once this craving arises, there's pain, grief, anguish, and unpleasantness.
What does the king think?
Would you rather be a concubine now?
This is Māra!
I'll pity you, too.
“O great king!

source_sentence: 妾亦有敗壞、有變異，寧可不生苦憂慼不樂耶？」
translation: Wouldn't the concubine also have decay and change, so why wouldn't suffering, grief, anguish, and unpleasantness arise?
You, Māra!

source_sentence: 敗壞有變異，我亦當生憂慼苦不樂。」
translation: When it breaks down and changes, I'll also experience grief, pain, and unpleasantness.
“O great king!

source_sentence: 以此當知之，愛生已則有憂慼苦不樂。」
translation: Because of this, you should know that after craving arises, there's grief, anger, pain, and unpleasantness.
This is Māra!
From today onward, that ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 因此事當為我師，我為弟子。
translation: Because of these things, you will be my teacher and I will be your disciple.
This is Māra!

source_sentence: 我今歸彼世尊、法及比丘僧，我於彼世尊持優婆塞，從今日始離於殺，
translation: I now turn to the World-honored One, the Dharma and all the bhikṣus of the sangha. From today onwards, I will abstain from killing those lay followers who uphold the doctrine o f the World-honored One
Now, I'll take refuge in the Buddha.

source_sentence: 如是說，王波斯匿遙聞世尊所說，歡喜而樂。
translation: Having said this, King Prasenajit heard the World-honored One’s exhortation from a distance. He was delighted and happy.

source_sentence: 佛說婆羅門子命終愛念不離經
translation: Foshuo prātimokṣasūtra
